result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

22CF183 & 20CM306 have a total of $5000 for Bond
Bail/bond hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark A Zopfi appeared by video. 
Officer Lt. Dean is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being employed with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to receiving a tip that the defendant was given a description of a vehicle the defendant was driving. Testifies to conducting a traffic stop of that vehicle. Testifies to the defendant being the driver. Testifies to a search being conducted and the substance found. Testifies to the substance being tested and the results. 
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
